summary: The Military Spouse Hiring Act (H.R. 2033) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a work opportunity credit for employers who hire the spouses of military personnel. This will incentivize businesses to employ military spouses by offering a tax credit, making them 'qualified military spouses' as defined by the bill. The bill's provisions apply to payments made for individuals who begin work after the date of enactment.
